poem:
Title: "Affliction and Silence in Rome"

In Rome, the picture flickered to life,
A hand departing in terse cruelty
evoking a silence as startling as the slap.
On the screen, tomorrow still exists,
yet today, in my bed,
echoes of Italian familial ghosts
haunt the fleeting darkness.
Startled by the auditory echo,
I lay scribed in the script of others,
Reading the lines between each sound.
